data.title: Easton Corbin to perform in Las Cruces; Bataan marchers can get in free
data.meta_description: Country music singer Easton Corbin will be stopping in Las Cruces on his tour\u00a0for a performance on Friday, March 15 at the NMSU Pan American Center.
data.text:
LAS CRUCES - Country music singer Easton Corbin along with guest Honey County, will perform Friday, March 15, at the New Mexico State University's Pan American Center.

Corbin, who released his self-titled debut album in March 2010 features two number one hits, "A Little More Country Than That" and "Roll With It" and another top 20 hit, "I Can't Love You Back." The rising country star has several other top 10 hits, awards and nominations under his belt.

Corbin toured with Carrie Underwood on her 2016 The Storyteller Tour: Stories in the Round. Since then, the Florida native has spawned hits like "Baby Be My Love Song" and "Are You With Me." His most recent single, "A Girl Like You," landed at number three on the country singles chart.

Corbin's latest single, "Somebodyâ€™s Gotta Be Country," is already climbing it's way up the charts.

The Bataan Memorial Death March will have a limited amount of free general admission tickets available to registered participants. Tickets will be distributed at the packet pick-up starting 2 p.m. Thursday, March 14, at the Las Cruces Convention Center, 680 E. University Ave. The march takes place March 17 at White Sands Missile Range.

Tickets will be distributed on a first come, first served basis, with a maximum of one ticket per marcher, while supplies last. For information, visit https://bataanmarch.com/about-bataan/contact-us/

Make plans

Time: 7 p.m.

Date: Friday, March 15

Place: NMSU Pan American Center, 1810 E. University Ave.

Other info: Purchase tickets at www.ticketmaster.com Tickets are $15 to $20. To learn more about VIP experience tickets, visit www.eastoncorbin.com

Jacqueline Devine can be reached at 575-541-5476, JDevine@lcsun-news.com or @JackieIsDevine on Twitter.

More: The Amador entertainment complex scheduled to open by end of March
